Function Documentation

nitf_DLL* nitf_DLL_construct (  nitf_Error *  error  ) 
 

Construct a DLL object This does nothing more than a memset, and a ZERO, and then it returns the object

Parameters:
error An error object to fill on problem
Returns:
A DLL object, or NULL upon failure

void nitf_DLL_destruct (  nitf_DLL **  dll  ) 
 

Destroy the dll object. If the lib value is not null, calls nitf_DLL_unload(). NULLs the pointer

Parameters:
dll A double pointer to the object

NITF_BOOL nitf_DLL_isValid (  nitf_DLL *  dll  ) 
 

NITF_BOOL nitf_DLL_load (  nitf_DLL *  dll,
const char *  libname,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Load the DLL object with an actual library. This is the equivalent of LoadLibrary() in windows.

Parameters:
dll The DLL to load to
libname The libname to use (this sets the value in the DLL object)
error An error object to populate if there is a problem
Returns:
A status to be tested using NITF_FAILURE()

NITF_DLL_FUNCTION_PTR nitf_DLL_retrieve (  nitf_DLL *  dll,
const char *  function,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Returns a pointer to a DLL function by the name

Parameters:
dll The DLL to retrieve from
function The FARPROC function to call
error Object to populate on error
Returns:
A pointer to the FARPROC function

NITF_BOOL nitf_DLL_unload (  nitf_DLL *  dll,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Unload the structure. This may shrink the executable size.

Parameters:
dll The object to unload
error An error to be populated on failure
Returns:
A status to be tested using NITF_FAILURE()
